name: 4-chloro-3-fluorophenol

The chlorine atom also increases the melting point by contributing to the molecular polarity and enhancing van der Waals forces due to its larger size and polarizability, adding approximately +20°C. However, the presence of these substituents in close proximity on the benzene ring may lead to some steric hindrance and electronic effects that reduce their cumulative impact on the melting point. Therefore, a correction factor is subtracted, estimated at -63.5°C, to align the predicted value with the actual observed melting point.
